comments.text:
+Jordan Wayne I can give you observable evidence, but knowing your type, I 
know you will brush it off and say some generic thing about the Bible being 
all-powerful and crap. Nonetheless, here is my attempt. Just observe animal 
behavior. Hell, just truly analyze all animals (us included), you can see 
there are tons of similarities still lingering between us. Dolphins can 
communicate and have sex for fun. Dogs may sacrifice themselves for the 
lives of other species. Our hearts are really similar to pig hearts. Our 
DNA is 60% the same as a banana tree. The list can go on and on. What does 
this point to? A common ancestor. Now, be vary careful of what YOU THINK 
about evolution, and what the theory of evolution really entails. There is 
a difference between saying "different kind of animals evolved into 
different ones", and saying there was a common ancestor, and due to 
different living conditions, different species required different changes 
to continue the lineage. Simply look at how we different people around the 
world are, each with distinct characteristics that we can recognize right 
away. Now, imagine that these group of people were segregated from each 
other, meaning Europeans cannot travel to America, or Asians can't travel 
to Africa. Set the timer and let it sit for a few thousand or even million 
years, and guess what? We would have different human species! Just like we 
have with animals. This is one of the hardest concepts to make others 
understand, because it is so easy to overlook phenomena that happens beyond 
our time span (thousands or millions of years).

Also, don't you think it is really convenient that the Vatican is keeping 
those kind of secrets? I mean, come on! It is like the 5 year old that says 
"I know the answer, but I won't tell you, lol!". 

Human beings are noted for recording spectacular events (aka. comets, 
earthquakes, and stuff). If miracles did indeed happen, they would be 
thousands and thousands of them recorded, and that would give scientists an 
opportunity to try to study them. Miracles are really just really nice 
coincidences, and just because you decide to attribute it or not to God, 
doesn't mean that God actually had anything to do with it.

Energy Cannot Naturally Be Created or Destroyed

One of most basic laws of science is the Law of the Conservation of Energy. 
Energy cannot be created or destroyed; it can only be changed from one form 
to another.
Energy is not currently being created. The universe could not have created 
itself using natural processes because nature did not exist before the 
universe came into existence. Something beyond nature must have created all 
the energy and matter that is observed today. Present measures of energy 
are immeasurably enormous, indicating a power source so great that 
"infinite" is the best word we have to describe it.  The logical conclusion 
is that a supernatural Creator with infinite power created the universe. 
There is no energy source capable to originate what we observe today.﻿

+Marco Fatica I don’t need to explain why it wouldn’t be you because I 
would never make that claim.  An exact to-the-atom recreation of your brain 
would be “you”.

Unfortunately there is a 0% (literally 0 in this case) of that happening 
except through the normal birthing process etc., in which case even if you 
atomically matched then and before in the womb, you would still become a 
different person later via your different experiences etc. (and thus a 
meaningless “you”).  You wouldn’t even match atomically for long as your 
new mother eats different food, takes different routes to work etc.  Not to 
mention that even if it was on Earth, gravity would be different, the 
climate would be different (this matters heavily), the stress your mother 
endures would vary (this matters heavily), etc.
If not on Earth, you can expect all of these to be *significantly* 
different, making it literally impossible for you to maintain the same 
atomic structure for any meaningful period of time in the womb.

It is literally impossible for you to actually be birthed atomically the 
same without explicit intervention.

It’s best to just give up on the idea of life after death.

comments.text:
+Marco Fatica Then you haven’t read what I already wrote to another who 
tried to make the same point in this same video.

The short-hand of it is that given infinite time, not every single event is 
guaranteed to happen.  Your statistical analysis is flawed.

If I have a 1-in-6 chance of getting a 1 when rolling a die, and I roll it 
is 6 times, it is not guaranteed to ever result in a 1.

Believing that every single possible thing will happen just given enough 
time or chances is simply an error.

No matter how much time passes, your chances at ever being reborn are 
virtually 0 (and in many senses literally 0).

comments.text:
+King Kyle
Well I'm glad to hear that you're on the path to reason :D. But I feel like 
I need to clear up the definitions for you a little bit, so I'm gonna 
copy-paste something from a previous comment I wrote:

AGNOSTICISM/GNOSTICISM:
There is a knowledge claim and a belief claim.

*Knowledge*:
Agnosticism: I don't know if a god exists for certain.
Gnosticism: I know whether or not a god exists.

*Belief*
Atheism: I don't believe in a god.
Theism: I believe in a god.

*You must choose one from each category*

When you combine them you get four different outcomes, and every single 
person on Earth falls into at least one of them.
*Agnostic Atheist*: I don't believe in a god, but I don't know if one 
exists for certain.
*Gnostic Atheist*: I don't believe in a god, and I know one does not exist.
*Agnostic Theist*: I believe in a god, but I don't know for certain if he 
exists.
*Gnostic Theist*: I believe in a god, and I know he exists.

Agnostic is *not* a middle-ground. If someone asks you if you believe in a 
god, and you say "I don't know", you're only addressing the knowledge 
portion, you also have to address the belief portion. If you don't 
*actively* subscribe to a god belief, you're by *definition* an atheist.

is like the body clinging on to itself and 'not wanting' to return to the 
Earth, as if it were somehow something separate and NOT a part of that 
which created it? But the body arises OUT OF the Earth, death is not a 
separate process that happens to "me" as a separate creature that exists 
outside and separate from all the processes of life? To fear death is to 
cling to the tension known to the mind as 'fear,' but the tension is simply 
one of the body. So the body holds a tension out of a misunderstanding of 
its relationship to life proper. because the ego believes itself to be 
something wholly separate from all that there is, and therefore resists the 
'idea' of death, and manifests the resistance as a physical tension in the 
body. Be nice to your body, embrace life and death. Nothing is separate. 
You are not a fluke.
comments.author: D. Sch.

comments.text:
+D. Sch. I'm really confused what "You" people are referring to that 
remains after the death of the body? Like, what "You" was present before 
you were born? How can there be a conscious "You" to perceive with no 
conscious vessel to perceive through? Doesn't mean ANOTHER "You" doesn't 
arise at some indeterminate point of time in the form of a different 
conscious vessel (this is what I think is meant by reincarnation). Like 
asking, what was it like to wake up without ever having gone to sleep 
(being born), or what is it like to go to sleep without ever waking up 
(death)? NBD except because we learn to fear it for some reason? Fear what 
exactly? And who is doing the fearing exactly? The body? Which won't be 
around to deal with the non-experience anyway? LOL
comments.author: D. Sch.

comments.text:
+D. Sch. Worrying about the experience of what happens to the body after 
death is sort of like worrying about the experience of what happens to your 
parents' bodies before you're conceived.... and you will experience it just 
as vigorously as you experienced that. :)
comments.author: D. Sch.

captions.text:
Yes, partially decayed zombies are gross,
but what REALLY happens to THIS BEAUTIFUL

SPECIMEN OF HUMAN MEAT after it dies? Let's
get grossly detailed!!!

Death is as natural as birth, but celebrated
a lot less. At the moment of death, the brain

has a surge of activity as its last oxygen
is depleted, and it then goes dark. Hormones

which regulate body functions stop being secreted
by the brain, and though some physical functions

continue for a few minutes, eventually all
human functions stop and the post-death process
begins.

Firstly, at death, all muscles relax. It takes
burning oxygen for energy to keep you tense,

no O2, no tension. This includes the body's
sphincters, which is why death often cause

defecation and incontinence. Now, just because
the body is medically DEAD, doesn't mean everything

is. Some cells continue burning remaining
energy, which contributes to what happens

after we die. Not to mention the 100 trillion
bacteria living in our intestines, on our

skin and elsewhere. They've been with us our
whole lives… no reason to stop now.

Algor mortis, or the death chill, begins immediately
at death. On average, a human body loses 1.5

degrees (.83 C) an hour until it reaches room
temperature. Without a heartbeat, blood and

fluids begin the lividity process, succumbing
to gravity and pooling at the lowest points

in the body. In light-skinned people, pooling
blood is visible outside the body as a dark

purplish-blue, and after two hours it clots!
This is how forensic specialists can tell
if a body has been moved.

Within three to six hours, rigor mortis sets
in, tensing the muscles again. After death,

calcium floods the muscles, and bonds with
proteins that control muscle contraction.

This uncontrolled bonding causes muscles to
tense for 24-to-48 hours. The eyes will cloud

over during this time, especially if left
open. And once rigor sets in, they're stuck

that way for a while, so that whole closing
eye thing in movies? It's possible as long

as you get to them quickly. Though you might
not have to, because according to a study

in the Indian Journal of Palliative Care,
63 percent of people fully closed their eyes
at death! Which seems like a lot to me...

OKAY. SO. You're dead, and decomposition is
starting. Your cells are dead, and are begining

to break down. In this case, cell death happens
because of necrosis. It's messy, and without

circulation, the body can't come clean up
the dead cell. As carbon dioxide builds up

and the pH of the tissues rise, the cells
weaken and eventually their membranes break,

releasing their insides into the surrounding
tissue. Enzymes in that fluid cause damage,

blistering and color changes, this continues
for a while...

By the second or third day putrefaction sets
in. Oxygen is been depleted by the natural

microorganisms in our respiratory and gastrointestinal
systems, and they've begun to spread into

other sections of the body. For example: enzymes
in the pancreas cause it to digest itself,

and the gut bacteria LOVE that, so they eat
it too -- which turns the abdomen a greenish

color. Gas begins to build up, forcing any
non-digestibles like feces; out of the body.

This is when the smell is just… beyond horrible.
I've smelled it, you don't want to. Two organic

amine chemicals: putrescine and cadaverine
are created during this interaction, and eventually

it makes its way into the blood vessels. Picture
a post-apocalyptic highway… using that,

they get to the rest of the body and ooze
out causing a horrid rotting smell. Eventually,

necrosis and the work of bacteria changes
the greenishness, to purple, and then BLACK.

The smell causes more insects to come lay
eggs and invade the body. A single blowfly

can lay 300 eggs which will hatch in a single
day. Their larvae will hatch and eat tissues

nearby for a week as a maggot before transforming
into a fly itself! Over the next week, maggots

and bacteria pop holes in the body, releasing
the gas (and the smell) even more. These maggots

can consume 60-percent of a body in just a
week! But there's still a lot to go, this

was just the first WEEK. Next, butyric fermentation
starts and the organs and tissues begin to

dry out and wax over, sort of like a mummy!
The tissues are being slowly digested by MORE

bacteria, insects, protozoa, and fungi. This
stage takes a long time, maybe as much as
a year or more in moderate temperatures.

Once the fluids are mostly dry, post-decay
starts. The soft tissues and organs are dried

up and consumed, but bones, hair, cartilage
and sticky byproducts of the earlier stages

are still around. This is when a variety of
beetles and flies move in each species looking

to eat away at part of what's left. Over the
subsequent years, plants and animals will

eat away the skeleton and eventually… dust
to dust. Gone forever.

Of course, in modern life, we usually never
get past the first few days. Embalming helps

delay much of these processes, as does cooling
the body! This is if you left a human laying

around, like an old pizza. Sure, we die, but
all these things live on thanks to our gross

wet corpses! It's inevitable, and fascinating.
I could do five more episodes on this stuff!

Let us know what you think about this down
below… not like… buried or whatever…
like in the comments.
